_comment: Maps user's gym-specific exercise names to canonical exercise names in exercise_list_complete.json

new_muscles_added.Gluteus Medius: Hip abductor, activated during hip abduction and single-leg stance exercises
new_muscles_added.Adductors: Inner thigh muscles (magnus, longus, brevis), highly active in squats and adduction machine
new_muscles_added.Lower Trapezius: Depresses and rotates scapula, active in rows and overhead movements
new_muscles_added.Obliques: Side core muscles, rotation and lateral flexion
new_muscles_added.Hip Flexors: Iliopsoas complex, raises thigh toward torso
new_muscles_added.Forearm Flexors: Wrist curling muscles on palm side
new_muscles_added.Forearm Extensors: Wrist extension muscles on back of forearm

research_notes.Nordic Curl: Very high hamstring EMG (72-124% MVIC) but hypertrophy studies show lengthened-position training may be superior
research_notes.Glute Ham Raise: Highest concentric hamstring activation among hip hinge exercises (McAllister 2014)
research_notes.Reverse Nordic Curl: Specifically targets rectus femoris which is underactivated in squats (Kubo 2019)
research_notes.Overhead Triceps Extension: 1.5x greater long head hypertrophy vs neutral position (Maeo 2022)
research_notes.Standing Calf Raise: Gastrocnemius shows NO significant hypertrophy with seated calf raises (Kinoshita 2023)
research_notes.Hip Abduction Machine: 80% MVIC for gluteus medius with favorable GMed:TFL ratio vs free weights
research_notes.Preacher Curl: Emphasizes short head and distal biceps due to shoulder flexion
research_notes.Close Grip Bench: Higher clavicular pec and triceps activation, lower biceps activation vs wide grip
